actor_awards.notes: Swedish-American actor best known for his portrayal of detective Charlie Chan in 16 films and for playing various Asian roles, including Dr. Fu Manchu and Henry Chang in 'Shanghai Express'. He also played the Cantor father in the landmark film 'The Jazz Singer'.

filmography.title: The Jazz Singer
filmography.role_description: The strict, traditional father who disowns his son for singing jazz instead of becoming a cantor.
filmography.plot: The son of a Jewish Cantor must defy the traditions of his religious father in order to pursue his dream of becoming a jazz singer.

filmography.title: Shanghai Express
filmography.role_description: A Eurasian rebel leader who hijacks the train and holds the passengers hostage.
filmography.plot: Various passengers on a train from Peking to Shanghai get caught up in the Chinese Civil War when the train is hijacked.

filmography.title: Werewolf of London
filmography.role_description: A mysterious scientist who is also a werewolf and infects the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A botanist seeking a rare flower in Tibet is bitten by a werewolf, and the creature follows him back to London.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan at the Opera
filmography.role_description: The aphorism-spouting detective who solves a murder mystery backstage at an opera house.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan investigates a murder at an opera house where an escaped amnesiac is the prime suspect.

filmography.title: The Mysterious Dr. Fu Manchu
filmography.role_description: The diabolical criminal mastermind who seeks revenge against the British officers he blames for the death of his family.
filmography.plot: During the Boxer Rebellion, a Chinese doctor plots revenge against the British army officers who killed his wife and child.

filmography.title: The Black Camel
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates the murder of a movie star in Hawaii.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan solves the murder of a film star who is killed in her pavilion in Honolulu.

filmography.title: Don Juan
filmography.role_description: The villainous Italian nobleman and member of the Borgia family.
filmography.plot: Don Juan learns that there is more to life than his many conquests when he falls for a woman who resists his charms.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan in London
filmography.role_description: Chan travels to London and tries to save a man wrongly convicted of murder.
filmography.plot: After solving a case in London, Charlie Chan is asked to investigate a murder for which a young man is about to be hanged.

filmography.title: The Painted Veil
filmography.role_description: A Chinese warlord who interacts with the Western characters during a cholera epidemic.
filmography.plot: A woman accompanies her husband to China where he fights a cholera epidemic, and she re-evaluates her shallow life.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan at the Olympics
filmography.role_description: Chan tracks spies and a stolen invention to the Berlin Olympic Games.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan tracks spies to the Berlin Olympics to recover a stolen remote control device for airplanes.

filmography.title: Dishonored
filmography.role_description: A high-ranking Austrian officer who becomes a target of the spy X-27.
filmography.plot: A widow turns to prostitution and then spying for Austria during World War I.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan in Egypt
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates the disappearance of an archaeologist during an expedition in Egypt.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan is hired to find out why valuable artifacts from an excavation in Egypt are ending up in private collections.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan on Broadway
filmography.role_description: Chan gets involved in a murder case in New York City after a woman hides a diary in his luggage.
filmography.plot: When a woman is murdered in a New York nightclub, Charlie Chan must find the killer among the city's nightlife.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan at Treasure Island
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates a mystic who blackmails his clients, leading to murder at the San Francisco World's Fair.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan investigates the death of a friend on the flight to San Francisco and uncovers a fake psychic racket.

filmography.title: Bulldog Drummond
filmography.role_description: The criminal mastermind and arch-nemesis of Captain Hugh 'Bulldog' Drummond.
filmography.plot: Bored ex-soldier Bulldog Drummond helps a young woman whose uncle is being held prisoner in a 'nursing home'.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan at the Circus
filmography.role_description: Chan takes his family to the circus but ends up investigating the murder of one of the owners.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan investigates when the co-owner of a circus is murdered, and the suspects include a gorilla.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan in Paris
filmography.role_description: Chan goes undercover to investigate bank bond forgeries in Paris.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan is sent to Paris to investigate bond forgeries but finds a murder.

filmography.title: Old San Francisco
filmography.role_description: A corrupt city boss in San Francisco who is actually a disguised Mongol prince.
filmography.plot: A cruel boss of the San Francisco underworld plots to take the hacienda of a Spanish family.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan in Shanghai
filmography.role_description: Chan returns to China to break up an opium smuggling ring.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan arrives in Shanghai to visit his family and help the local police stop an opium smuggling ring.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan's Secret
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates the reappearance of an heir who was presumed dead.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan investigates the murder of the heir to a fortune who turns up dead after being missing for seven years.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan at Monte Carlo
filmography.role_description: Chan plans to vacation in Monte Carlo but gets drawn into a murder investigation involving casino chips.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan tries to go on vacation in Monte Carlo but is detained by the police to help solve a murder.

filmography.title: The Return of Dr. Fu Manchu
filmography.role_description: Oland reprises his role as the evil genius plotting revenge.
filmography.plot: Dr. Fu Manchu returns to seek revenge on those he believes are responsible for the death of his wife.

filmography.title: Riders of the Purple Sage
filmography.role_description: A character in the silent adaptation of Zane Grey's western novel.
filmography.plot: A mysterious rider protects a young woman from a corrupt judge and his henchmen in the Old West.

filmography.title: Daughter of the Dragon
filmography.role_description: Fu Manchu returns, promising to kill the Petrie family, but is apparently killed, leaving his daughter to take over.
filmography.plot: Fu Manchu's daughter falls in love with a detective while trying to carry out her father's revenge.

filmography.title: Charlie Chan at the Race Track
filmography.role_description: Chan investigates a horse racing gambling ring that uses foul play to win.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chan investigates a gambling ring that is fixing horse races, leading to murder.

filmography.title: Tell It to the Marines
filmography.role_description: A bandit leader who conflicts with the US Marines.
filmography.plot: A tough Marine sergeant trains recruits and leads them into action, while dealing with a romantic rivalry.
